labIntro.title: H!NT Lab
labIntro.p1: H!NT Lab (Human-Intelligence iNTegration Lab) focuses on exploring cutting-edge technologies for the deep integration of human intelligence and machine intelligence, dedicated to building more natural, efficient, and intelligent human-AI collaboration systems.
labIntro.researchIntro: Our research centers on three core areas:

areas.title: Human-AI Cognitive Collaboration
areas.description: Exploring synergistic mechanisms between human cognition and AI

areas.title: Human-Computer Interaction
areas.description: Developing more natural and efficient interaction technologies

areas.title: Natural Language Understanding
areas.description: Deep research on language understanding and generation

labIntro.synergy: These three directions mutually support and synergistically develop: deep natural language understanding provides more natural communication methods for human-computer interaction, advanced interaction technologies make human-AI cognitive collaboration more efficient, and cognitive collaboration research in turn guides and optimizes language understanding and interaction design.

about.title: About
about.p1: Dr. Hao Wang is an Associate Professor at Shanghai University, specializing in Artificial Intelligence (AI), Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Human-Computer Collaborative Cognition. Following a Ph.D. from Waseda University, Japan, and supported by a CSC scholarship, his professional experience includes roles at Microsoft Research Asia (MSRA), Toshiba, and NTT, providing him with a unique international perspective on R&D. Dr. Wang is a Principal Investigator of the National Natural Science Foundation of China (NSFC) and has published over 30 conference and journal papers in top-tier AI venues like CogSci, COLING, and EMNLP. Crucially, he is currently serving as a seconded Deputy Director at the Putuo District Data Bureau in Shanghai, actively bridging his academic research—particularly in developing intelligent OS-Level and context-aware agents—with Smart Governance and practical public administration solutions
about.p2: We primarily welcome students with NLP backgrounds, and also those from linguistics, cognitive science, and psychology. International students are also welcome.
